Issues.Title: Cannot read property '_isDestroyed' of undefined"
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.10

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/Ystr4/is_destroyed_error](https://github.com/Ystr4/is_destroyed_error)







### Steps to reproduce
The repo starts off with a working example. 

To get the error,  go to components/ScreenElement.vue and simply replace example 1 with example 2, and click on toggle again.



### What is expected?
To get an error if a component fails to render

### What is actually happening?
Trying to cleanup something that doesn't exist

---
Hi,
I'm rewriting an old barebones javascript frontend using Vue.js.
Allot of the content of the site is created with a custom tool which outputs the format provided in App.vue->data.
For every entry in "Locations", ScreenElement.vue gets called.
The output of ScreenElement(VNode) gets assigned to current.children(see _build in BuildScreen.vue).
This seems to be working fine for most template, but on some of the templates I get this error in the destroy cycle.

It seems to me that when some of the elements in the template are not getting created for whatever reason (no errors in console however),
vue still expects them to be instantiated, which then results in the TypeError.
Does this have something to do with how I create the parent/child hierarchy by asigning to children on the VNode?

I'm getting this error in other components aswell(not included in this project) but it was easier to reproduce with this HtmlWrapper, which only creates the fieldset for some reason, 
i don't understand why this happens either, but that is beside the point. 

I have included 3 example situations you can swap between(see ScreenElement.vue), only the first one actually produces the error.

Any suggestions are welcome. Cheers.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cannot read property '_isDestroyed' of undefined"" (#10295)

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:

lastIndex will auto-update in `RegExp.prototype.exec`, We do not need update manually
- https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-regexpbuiltinexec

**Other information:**

```js
var a = /a/g
var lastIndex = a.lastIndex
var match = a.exec("baa")
match[0].length + match.index === a.lastIndex
```

Issues.Title: Dynamic input with component doesn't update UI
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.10

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/vue-template-hi3gb](https://codesandbox.io/s/vue-template-hi3gb)







### Steps to reproduce
Create an input component with the <component /> tag, and bind the value and input events for data updates:
<component :is="'input'" :value="text1" @input="text1 = $event.target.value"/>

Edit the input value manually and you can confirm the data is being updated.

Programatically change the data and everything depending on the data will update including the "value" of the input, but the visual UI for the input will still show the old data.

### What is expected?
If I clear the data programmatically, the input should also clear

### What is actually happening?
Clearing the data functionally works, but visually leaves the previous data as the input value.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dynamic input with component doesn't update UI" (#10290)

Issues.Title: Can template parser avoid loosing comments betwen conditionals?
Issues.Body: ### What problem does this feature solve? Libraries like vuese or vue-docgen-api, use comments to determine how to document slots, props, methods, and events. It gets comments from a JavaScript AST for the JavaScript code. Using the `vue-template-compiler` parser, it does the same for HTML templates. Here is the catch: If a comment is in-between conditions of `v-if`/`v-else`, see below, the comment will not be in the returned AST. ```vue ``` Since I am using these comments to build the appropriate documentation objects, those comments will never bubble up. ### What does the proposed API look like? What if `ASTifCondition` could contain their own comment field? The field would contain the `comment` as an ASTText object just before the condition allowing conditions to be commented and parsed. Should it only contain the last one? Should it contain an array of comments? Should its name even be comments? Is there performance concerns to look at? Thank you in advance. I already created a PR #10286 for the desired API. I can change it however you decide.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Can template parser avoid loosing comments betwen conditionals?" (#10288)

Issues.Title: Consistency in `$refs`: all children of $refs array using same format.
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve? I know this is intended as a feature, but I encountered a lot of issues when trying to access $refs due to all the different formats: - If `ref` is inside a `v-for`, the `$refs` element will be an array. This wouldn't be necessary since is trivial to add an unique name to the `ref` inside a loop, [as seen in this example](https://forum.vuejs.org/t/this-refs-theid-returns-an-array/31995/4) - If `ref` is outside of a `v-for`, it will be a DOM Node. - Except that when the referenced item is a custom component, then it will be an object and to access the DOM node you would have to read the `$el` property... So basically, if we wanted to select a ref's node, and we wouldn't know if it's a node or a custom component, if it's in a for-loop or not, this would be the code: ``` const ref = (this.$refs.test && this.$refs.test[0] && this.$refs.test[0].$el) ? this.$refs.test[0].$el : (this.$refs.test && this.$refs.test.$el) ? this.$refs.test.$el : (this.$refs.test && this.$refs.test[0]) ? this.$refs.test[0] : this.$refs.test ? this.$refs.test : null;` ``` So far I've never encountered this case, but I did encounter: - The case where the ref could be either a node or a custom component â€” I wanted to add a class and remove it with a timeout, for animation purposes. At the end, my workaround was to create a custom component to handle the "empty state" of a component, to consistently be able to reference the node using `.$el` (this was easier than refactoring all the parts where `.$el` was being referenced)- - The case where the ref could either be a node or an array of nodes, in a case of a list that had a default value (the default value was outside of the "for loop"). My proposal is to have a consistent way of referencing a node/component inside templates. An idea I found in [another issue of this repo](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/2044) is to use a special syntax when the ref is expected to be an array: ```
``` Another part of the proposed change is to be able to access the DOM Node using `$el` (__always__ and exclusively that way). Since this is a breaking change, it would be interesting to hear workarounds for this. For example, using a different keyword altogether. In general, I think this would add a lot of sanity and consistency to the usage of `$refs`, and I think it's a common issue for a lot of beginners. Note: this feature request is not compatible with [this other feature request](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/4035) ### What does the proposed API look like? ``` vue-html
(or ref:nested="example")
``` ``` js // Refs array [ 0: { $el:
}, // simple node item 1: { $el:
, methods, data, etc..... }, // ref in custom component ... } ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Consistency in `$refs`: all children of $refs array using same format." (#10284)

Issues.Title: @click.prevent causes checkbox :checked property to not render
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.10

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/meekohi/pen/jjgezj](https://codepen.io/meekohi/pen/jjgezj)







### Steps to reproduce
Use `@click.prevent=` along with a `:checked='booleanComponentProp'` on a checkbox. Clicking the checkbox correctly updates all data, but the checkbox visually remains in whatever the original state was.

### What is expected?
Checkbox should update based on the `:checked` property.

### What is actually happening?
Checkbox does not update.

---
This bug did not exist in Vue 2.5.22 -- it seems like Vue 2.6 started relying on the native `click` event to change the state of the box for the simple case, but if the underlying property changes via some other mechanism (for example a prop updating) then the checkbox visual appearance gets out of sync with the underlying data.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Consider use QuickJS for SSR (Server Side Rendering)
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Lots of larger enterprises use Java or any JVM based language for building their backend system historically. Mostly because there are too many different systems in place and it is quite difficult to move to nodeJS with their limited resources. There are a few other options which are using other languages to act as  JavaScript Engine out there which don't seem to perform well or didn't gain a lot of attraction in the past. E.g Rinho from Mozilla, Jav8 from Google. With the  release of QuickJS (https://bellard.org/quickjs/) from FFMPEG author Fabrice Bellard, it may become a better choice for everyone who has suffered from SPA performance issue or SEO related complaints.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Similar to the example on https://ssr.vuejs.org/guide/non-node.html, I've tried to use a few examples to provide a proof of concept build.  Check https://github.com/soleo/quickjs-docker out for details.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Visiting another page immediately creates the respective component, before disposing the component of the previous page.
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.7

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/vuex-register-unregister-module-roli-roli-ct4kz](https://codesandbox.io/s/vuex-register-unregister-module-roli-roli-ct4kz)







### Steps to reproduce
1. When the page loads you are in the home component (/ route)
2. Click the Contact button to navigate to the contact component (/contact route)
3. Observe the error in the console.

In the Home and Contact components (or pages) I use store.registerModule and store.unregisterModule to dynamically register/unregister the same module.

### What is expected?
No error should be shown. If you go to the Home later About and later Contact page (and vise versa) everything works as expected.

### What is actually happening?
Vue router runs the new component before destroying the old one.

---
Initially I thought was a vuex issue and I opened one [here](https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/issues/1580). But then I saw that is a vue router issue. I tried to find if that issue already exists and couldn't find something.

As a workaround I can use transition mode out-in. And everything works
```js
    <transition mode="out-in">
      <router-view></router-view>
    </transition>
```

but to me, it doesn't makes sense to mount a component, before destroying the other one. What I am missing?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Visiting another page immediately creates the respective component, before disposing the component of the previous page. " (#2847)

Issues.Title: Best way to create vue-router - Online Shop
Issues.Body:
i have a little problem with prepare vue-router to my Online Shop. I have two level product category tree view with parent and child item.
My category view, is built dynamic of data get from the database:

>     PARENT
>     â€“ CHILD 1
>     â€“ CHILD 2
>     PARENT 2
>     â€“ CHILD 1
>     â€“ CHILD 2
>     PARENT 3
>     - CHILD 1
>     PARENT 4
>     - CHILD 1
>     - CHILD 2
> 

etc.
I donâ€™t know how to prepare dynamic router. Now, i do something like that:

```
    {
            name: 'Produkty',
            display: true,
            meta: { requiresAuth: false, menuType: 'topNav' },
            path: '/product/:categoryId?/:subCategoryId?',
            component: () => import(/* webpackChunkName: "home" */ './views/home/product')
          },
          {
            name: 'productDetail',
            display: false,
            meta: { requiresAuth: false },
            path: '/product/:categoryId/:subCategoryId/:productId',
            component: () => import(/* webpackChunkName: "home" */ './views/home/product/Details')
          }
```

I don't know is this a good way? Maybe anyone have better idea for this?
I also want to implement dynamic breadcrumbs base on router path.

And other question:
How to redirect from: http://localhost/produkt/1234/523/123(productId) to http://localhost/product_name.html for example ? Or.. id from url chage to http://localhost/parent_1/child_1/product_1 ??

Issues.Title: Color active state on link does not return to color
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.2

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/embed/vue-template-lgn63](https://codesandbox.io/embed/vue-template-lgn63)







### Steps to reproduce
Open the project in the browser.
The link with the name Say Hello appears in the browser.
The default color is green of the Say Hello link is green, when hovering or clicking on the link the color changes from green to gray.
The gray color remains in the Say Hello link, the expected behavior is that once you click and refresh the page the color returns to the original which is green.
In tests carried out in development environments, low resolutions are being presented with smart phone views.

### What is expected?
Fix the original color state bug, if the mouse cursor is positioned or the link is touched change color and return to its original state.

### What is actually happening?
The color of the link in desktop resolutions works correctly when you hover over the link or click. In low resolutions and smart phones when touching the link changes the active state color and does not return to the original color of the normal state.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Color active state on link does not return to color" (#2839)

Issues.Title: External JavaScript working when changing route
Issues.Body: ### What problem does this feature solve? I am currently facing an issue with the external javascipt stopping when changing routes. For example, when I start from / (root page), then click /shop, then click back / (root page), the external javascript stop working (Eg. plugin.js stop). I tried to use a plugin called vue-plugin-load-script. In order to dynamically load external javascript in main.js but the result is still the same, external javascript stops working when changing routes. this feature should allow the javascript works when changing routes. ### What does the proposed API look like? The external javascript is place in index.html index.html ``` ... ``` route.js ``` { path: '/', name: 'home', component: Home }, { path: '/shop', name: 'shop', component: Shop }, ``` App.vue ``` ``` External javascript is provided globally, so each page can be used. I wish to request a feature that the same external javascript works in different paths.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "External JavaScript working when changing route" (#2837)

Issues.Title: Handle Promise rejection in guards
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.3

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/orzwg537/](https://jsfiddle.net/orzwg537/)







### Steps to reproduce
Run the fiddle and look in console

### What is expected?
a message saying error caught

### What is actually happening?
There is an Unhandled Promise rejection instead

---
Currently, errors thrown in guards are caught by router.onError but Promises rejections (or error thrown in an `async` function) are not caught. This should be handled in all the other guards as well

Issues.Title: Enable component async loading
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
For now there is no full support for `vue` `async components` described here:

https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/components-dynamic-async.html#Handling-Loading-State

Solution presented in: 
https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/pull/2140
https://github.com/chrisvfritz/vue-enterprise-boilerplate/blob/master/src/router/routes.js
is solving problem only partially because of such construction `beforeRouteEnter` etc guards are not launched due to fact that component is resolved inside another component after route update

This problem is also mentioned here:
https://forum.vuejs.org/t/vue-router-async-component-loading-error-components-never-shown/40618/2

### What does the proposed API look like?
Update doc with information that this syntax is not working with `vue-router`.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enable component async loading" (#2830)

Issues.Title: Actions mapped to namespaced modules pass unexpected explicit `undefined` payload to `store.dispatch`
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.1.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/markrian/pen/vqeGZZ?editors=0010](https://codepen.io/markrian/pen/vqeGZZ?editors=0010)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Open https://codepen.io/markrian/pen/vqeGZZ?editors=0010
1. Open the browser's console
1. Observe the differing logged arguments passed to `store.dispatch` depending on whether it's a root-mapped action or a namespace-mapped action (`[ "foo" ]` and `[ "childModule/foo", undefined ]` respectively - note the extra `undefined` argument in the second case; the different action name is of course expected)

Note that this only really applies in a testing scenario, where the test spies on `store.dispatch` to ensure the component dispatches the expected actions.

### What is expected?
`store.dispatch` receives exactly the same arguments regardless of whether the actions are namespace-mapped or not.

### What is actually happening?
`store.dispatch` receives a payload argument of `undefined` for namespace-mapped actions.

---
I encountered this when refactoring a store into a namespaced module, and found that my expectations needed to change: that `store.dispatch` received an extra `undefined` argument.

I'm not sure if this should be considered a bug in Vuex, or in my testing approach of spying on `store.dispatch` :man_shrugging: 

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Actions mapped to namespaced modules pass unexpected explicit `undefined` payload to `store.dispatch`" (#1571)

Issues.Title: Retrieve module context from store instance
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
This feature adds the ability to retrieve the store module context directly from root store instance.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Let's suppose, that `store` variable is my Vuex (root) store instance.

I solve this problem with the following code:

```
let subModuleContext = store._modulesNamespaceMap['subModuleName/'].context
```

It would be nice to write

```
let subModuleContext = store.getContext('subModuleName')
```

Then, I can write `subModuleContext.dispatch('someAction')` instead of `store.dispatch('subModuleName/someAction')`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Retrieve module context from store instance" (#1561)

Issues.Title: Disable Direct State Mutation Outside of Mutation Handlers, at Least in Strict Mode
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
As [doc](https://vuex.vuejs.org/guide/strict.html) said, 

> In strict mode, whenever Vuex state is mutated outside of mutation handlers, an error will be thrown. 

However, **state will still be mutated** though an error would be thrown. 

In my opinion, this behavior is weird and misleading. Normally,  operation would fail if an error showed. But in this case, it didn't. 

Also, if a developer doesn't see this error and only see the result which is actually worked, he might do this behavior all the time until one day he find the error.

 So, my propose is

>  Why Not Disable Direct State Mutation Outside of Mutation Handlers, at Least in Strict Mode?

There should be a way to absolutely disable direct state mutation outside of mutation handlers. 

### What does the proposed API look like?
```js
const store = new Vuex.Store({
  // ...
  strict: true
})
```
Direct state mutation outside of mutation handlers would be disabled when `strict` is true.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Disable Direct State Mutation Outside of Mutation Handlers, at Least in Strict Mode" (#1556)

Issues.Title: [BUG] the parent state's key is covered by the same key of the child module
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vuex

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->
[https://jsfiddle.net/msz5nv6e/](https://jsfiddle.net/msz5nv6e/)

```javascript
const store = new Vuex.Store({
  state: {
    a: 'From root state'
  },
  modules: {
    a: {  
      namespaced: true,
      state: {
        a: 'From a state'
      }
    }
  }
})
```

In the source installModule methodï¼Œthe module a will cover the root a stateï¼š

```javascript
if (!isRoot && !hot) {
    const parentState = getNestedState(rootState, path.slice(0, -1))
    const moduleName = path[path.length - 1]
    store._withCommit(() => {
      Vue.set(parentState, moduleName, module.state) // caused the bug 
    })
  }
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[BUG] the parent state's key is covered by the same key of the child module" (#1559)

Issues.Title: [Firefox] Zero value in an object is displayed as undefined in terminal but works as expected logically and displays properly
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.1.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/2tb9frcj/1/](https://jsfiddle.net/2tb9frcj/1/)







### Steps to reproduce
Run the reproduction, open the developer console panel, click on the "click", Look at the result and please click on the `Object > val`.

### What is expected?
0 is printed out when clicking on the output of:

```
console.log("Printed as undefined", store.state.tests[0])
```

### What is actually happening?
Printed as undefined but behaves like zero

---
I know that `mutations` are not asynchronous, so the `setTimeout` or `$nextTick` won't fix it; try clicking the button multiple times to add more entries but the old values still 'display' as undefined but behaves like zero.

Behaves like zero, so I'm fine with it. Printing out the value directly prints zero, so I'm fine with it. But this was HUGELY misleading in my case when it printed out `undefined`.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Firefox] Zero value in an object is displayed as undefined in terminal but works as expected logically and displays properly" (#1557)
